thread.title: More tax relief for NPS subscribers​
thread.title_full: More tax relief for NPS subscribers​

author: M Allirajan
title: More tax relief for NPS subscribers​
text:
W ith the aim of providing further relief to an employee subscriber of NPS (National Pension System), the Union Budget presented by finance minister Arun Jailtely in the Parliament on Wednesday has provided exemption to partial withdrawal, not exceeding 25% of the contribution made by an employee. 

The existing provisions allowed exemption of up to 40% of the total amount payable payments from an NPS trust to an employee on closure of account or if the person chooses to opt out. 

In order to provide parity between an individual who is an employee and an individual who is self-employed, the budget has increased the deduction available in case of individual other than employee under NPS from 10% of gross total income to 20%. 

The existing provisions provide that employee or other individuals shall be allowed a deduction for amount deposited in NPS trusts. The deduction cannot exceed 10% of salary in case of an employee or 10% of gross total income in case of other individuals. 

However, further deduction to an employee, in respect of contribution made by his employer, is allowed up to 10% of salary of the employee. 

"Thus, in case of an employee, the deduction allowed under Section 80CCD adds up to 20% of salary whereas in case of other individuals, the total deduction under section 80CCD is limited to 10% of gross total income," the budget memorandum said.
